Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
In accordance with IMTAR – 21, Subpart C1, 21.C1.18, Subpart C2, 21.C2.9 & Subpart C3, 21.C3.1.20.
Part - I (Reference): Incident /Accident/ Snag / Explosive
a) Defect Report (DR) No: DR/2022/0312 b) Date of Occurrence: 12/06/2023
c) Installation Details: Minotaur Heavy - AC-8176-936 at
Regional Depot-B
Part - II: (Details of Defective Component)
a) Trade: Electrical b) Date Component 19/06/2023
Received:
c) System/Sub System: Power Distribution d) Main Assembly: Station-2 Port
e) Nomenclature: Power Distribution Assembly Unit f) MOD Status: Standard
g) Part No.: EL-9531-N6 h) Sl No.: SN-9508-156
i) Firmware Version: FW-8.50.933 j) Software Version: Not Applicable
k) Date of Installation: 20/06/2020 l) Date of Removal: 17/06/2023
Pg No: 33 Ln No: 24 Pg No: 78 Ln No: 30
m) Manufacturing Agency: Summit Defense Solutions n) Date, Month & Year July 2017
of Manufacturing:
o) Whether under warranty: No p) Whether under AMC No
/ Repair Contract:
q) Life completed since New: 648 Hrs / 707 Cycles

--- Page 2 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Safety Critical
b) Defect Observed: Circuit breaker tripping under normal load. Abnormality observed during system test.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Foreign object damage to critical surface
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Power Distribution component.
Functional testing confirmed the reported anomaly.
c) Remedial Measures Replace entire assembly due to extent of damage
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Implement condition-based monitoring system
d) Attributable Code: U - Lapses on the part of User
Remarks: Comprehensive analysis performed. Root cause identified and verified.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Design assessment confirms component operated within specified limits. Recommend enhanced inspection protocol.
Date: 13/07/2023 Authorized Signatory of Design: Dr. P.L. Mehta

--- Page 3 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part VI: Remarks by Quality Dept.
Quality control procedures verified. Recommend periodic surveillance of manufacturing facility.
Date: 14/07/2023 Signature: Sqn Ldr V.K. Patel
Part VII: Remarks by User(Project):(if applicable)
User feedback incorporated. Recommend enhanced crew training on system operation and limitations.
Date: 15/07/2023 Signature: Sqn Ldr V.K. Patel
Part VIII: Remarks by ORDAQA (Quality Aspects)
From quality standpoint, root cause analysis is thorough. Corrective measures are appropriate. Concur.
Date: 19/07/2023 Signature: Sqn Ldr V.K. Patel
Part IX: Remarks by CEMILAC / RCMA (Design Aspects)
From regulatory standpoint, investigation meets required standards. Approve proposed corrective actions.
Date: 22/07/2023 Signature: Gp Capt V.S. Pillai
Edition Number: 1.0 Form Version Number: 1.0 Date: January 2021
